The Research of Intelligent Illumination for Classroom Based on Passive Localization

PENG Yi-he; HUO Chun-guang; WU Hao-yu; LIU Ying
Project

Abstract

For the problem of large-area illumination with little people or the light on in empty classroom, an intelligent illumination system for classroom based on WiFi was designed. Use WiFi’s Received Signal Strength Indicator and Back Propagation for identifying the people indoor non-contactly and analyzing the law of RSSI’s fluctuation to reversely infer the environmental characteristics of propagation path. According to the result, the existence of indoor people is determined. After getting the information of indoor people’s position, the corresponding lights would be turned on intelligently by microcontrollers, which will economize on electricity.
